description:
I explored Taskade a couple of years ago and I liked it well enough, but got tangled up with Scrivener and as such, I didn't feel the need to continue with Taskade. But at the time, I thought it was the most approachable and easy to understand of this sort of "Notion-like" products

I thought of Taskade when I decded Windows is a privacy stealing, technological dead end, and had to abandon Scrivener when I switched to Linux Mint. I'm gonna give it a fair retry, but I'm pretty uncomfortable with this new iteration of Taskade. I hate to say it, but Obsidian now seems a bit 'friendlier' than Taskade. 

I'm finding the whole "AI" thing a bit confusing. I'm a hobbiest novel writer who will likely never get published, but needs to think about what he is doing. And the templates now seem to be AI cnnected in some way. I think as a template, all I need is a way to set up a skeleton "Save the Cat" outline or a "5 Act" outline template. I dont think I need a computer's help in figuring stuff out, that's what brains are for, I just want a template to save me some time in setting up the infrastructure.

BTW, for Linux, you REALLY need a Flatpack release as well. Too many hoops to install in other distros for SNAP only Packs. That's certainly true for Mint.
summary: I liked it better before AI

description: Please fix it.
summary: Not able to launch, dont download

description: trash trash trash trash trash trash trash trash can you fix please

I downloaded.
I attempted to open.
I sat.
I swore.
I did not get to use.
I removed.
I reviewed.
App looks great, hope it's fixed soon.
Is it possible that I still cannot launch it?
don't download !

When I opened the application through the terminal, it issued the following:
[31434:1007/203421.491822:FATAL:setuid_sandbox_host.cc(157)] The SUID sandbox helper binary was found, but is not configured correctly. Rather than run without sandboxing I'm aborting now. You need to make sure that /snap/taskade/1/chrome-sandbox is owned by root and has mode 4755.
Trace/breakpoint trap (core dumped)


How to fix this problem?
Looks great but does not launch. Please make it open on Linux.

It installed easily, and runs perfectly on Ubuntu 18.  List view, MindMap view, Board view, Action view, Org Chart view.  Projects, Agenda, Roadmap, Templates, & Completed.  Subtasks, Recurring tasks, Percent complete, task lists, notes, and unlimited nested outlines.  Daily bullet journal and diary.   Project roadmaps and outliner.  You can create a workspace for your team, project, or idea. Workspaces help to keep your lists and notes organized. You can create as many workspaces as you like. Oriented toward team collaboration.   Also versions for Android, Windows, and Web.
summary: THEY FIXED IT !  NOW IT WORKS!  Give it another try

description: The app started normally but it's not worth it... I'm still looking for a good week planner...
summary: It worked for me, but I still uninstalled it

description: This is a good app

The app seems to be good but first they need to fix the basics. I can't log in the app and that makes the app pretty much unusable garbage. Please attend to the matter. Otherwise the app on iPad works pretty good with some minor bugs but I understand they are still newbies and need time.
summary: Please fix the app. I can't login with my google account

description:
Works for me on Ubuntu 20.04. There are some issues, for example when the app is started, it throws some errors. Log below:

===============================

Error org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.Failed: cannot use setting "default-url-scheme-handler": not allowed
(electron) The default value of app.allowRendererProcessReuse is deprecated, it is currently "false". It will change to be "true" in Electron 9. For more information please check https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/18397
Checking for update
Error: Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/snap/taskade/6/resources/app-update.yml'
Gtk-Message: 12:58:22.230: GtkDialog mapped without a transient parent. This is discouraged.
This error originated either by throwing inside of an async function without a catch block, or by rejecting a promise which was not handled with .catch(). The promise rejected with the reason:
Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/snap/taskade/6/resources/app-update.yml'
(node:57851) [DEP0005] DeprecationWarning: Buffer() is deprecated due to security and usability issues. Please use the Buffer.alloc(), Buffer.allocUnsafe(), or Buffer.from() methods instead.

================================

Minimazing the app will cause it to get stuck in the tray, and cannot be maximized again. Killing the app and relaunching it solves it. 

The app is usable for the most part, deducting 1 star because of the above issues.

First and foremost, It looks, functions, and performs great on ubuntu 20.04lts. one flaw that is kind of annoying is that i cannot minimize it from fullscreen mode. i have to put it in windowed mode and then minimize it. Correct that issue and its a pretty solid program otherwise
summary: Works ok but has some bugs

description: Doesn't work on full screen mode. Asks to purchase full version.
has issues, like can not minimize

I felt in love and lost hours of work making the best possible templates for it... The programme is well-thought and the functions great, runs with an app...till one day it stopped working and all that i get is a black screen from the software.
summary: I LOVED it but can't run it anymore

description: great option. works well at #47~20.04.2-Ubuntu SMP Mon Dec 13 11:06:56 UTC 2021
Works completely fine now. I used previously on windows, and now it works fine on ubuntu 22 as well.
summary: Works 100% fine on Ubuntu 22.04, would recommend

description: At first the app migh tmake an impression of an overengineered solution, but one gets used to it in a short time. I like the possibility to overview the projects in different representations, like mind-map, calendar or board. It is possible to embed external files and links. Pleasant GUI.
You must login to Taskade. All your data belongs to them.
Decent tool with tons of free features!
Nao funcionaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
ni si quiera se inicia

Al comienzo pide loguear. Una vez realizado este login en el navegador, abre la aplicación.
El resto es lo mismo que aparece en la versión web.
Je suis sous Ubuntu 19.04 et après avoir téléchargé cette app je ne peux pas la mettre en route pour l'utiliser, j'ai essayé avec le terminal, rien à faire, ça ne fonctionne pas
Au 19 novembre 2019, ne fonctionne pas sur Ubuntu 18.04
Il y a mieux et plus fonctionnel.
Pas de temps à perdre avec ça, et encore moins avec une appli propriétaire.
summary: Ne fonctionne pas en 2022 non plus
